title: Pahalgam attack: Officials probing if terrorists’ original target was PM’s visit
content: Intelligence chatter before the Pahalgam massacre indicated terror groups planned to target tourist spots in J&K, especially hotels near Srinagar. Despite generic warnings about potential attacks on tourists, laborers, and pilgrims in various areas, Baisaran lacked specific mention.

title: Air India diverts flight, suspends Tel Aviv route after missile strike near Israeli airport
content: Air India flight AI139, flying from Delhi to Tel Aviv, was diverted to Abu Dhabi after a missile strike occurred near Tel Aviv airport on Sunday. The Boeing 787 was about an hour away from landing when the incident prompted the diversion while it was in Jordanian airspace. Consequently, the return flight from Tel Aviv to Delhi has been cancelled.

title: Why there will be no other investor like Warren Buffett
content: Warren Buffett, the legendary investor and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway, will retire by the end of 2025, passing the reins to Greg Abel. Buffett transformed Berkshire into a diversified conglomerate, achieving staggering returns of 5,502,284% compared to the S&P 500's 39,054%.

title: Warren Buffet says Apple under Cook has contributed to Berkshire more than ...
content: Warren Buffett lauded Tim Cook's leadership at Apple, acknowledging his significant contribution to Berkshire Hathaway's financial gains. Despite reducing Berkshire's Apple stake, Buffett emphasized Cook's unique ability to develop Apple, drawing a comparison to Steve Jobs. Since Cook became CEO in 2011, Apple's stock has surged, driving its market capitalization to over $3 trillion.

title: Meet Akash Maharaj Singh: Rishabh Pant's secret weapon
content: Lucknow Super Giants chose to bowl first after winning the toss against Punjab Kings in Dharamsala. LSG captain Rishabh Pant cited potential early assistance for bowlers as the reason. LSG debutant Akash Singh, a left-arm pacer, and PBKS included Marcus Stoinis in their playing XI. Akash Singh's journey from a humble background to professional cricket is highlighted.

title: Russell's blitz, Rinku's brilliance in the field keep KKR in IPL playoffs race
content: Kolkata Knight Riders secured a nail-biting one-run victory against Rajasthan Royals in a high-scoring IPL 2025 match. Andre Russell's explosive half-century and Rinku Singh's exceptional fielding proved crucial for KKR. Despite Riyan Parag's brilliant 95, RR fell short, as KKR's bowlers held their nerve to keep their playoff hopes alive.

title: 'I feel awful...': Riyan Parag takes blame for Rajasthan Royals one-run loss
content: Riyan Parag shouldered the blame for Rajasthan Royals' narrow one-run defeat to Kolkata Knight Riders. Parag's impressive 95 couldn't secure the win as RR fell short chasing 207. He lamented his dismissal and miscalculation during the crucial 16th and 17th overs. Andre Russell's explosive 57 propelled KKR to their total, while RR's loss eliminated them from playoff contention.

title: Ray Dalio says Donald Trump’s tariff war is pushing America close to a recession
content: Ray Dalio, who predicted the 2008 crisis, warns that mishandled economic policies, particularly Trump's tariffs, could push the U.S. into a recession. He likens the tariffs' disruptive implementation to destabilizing the production system. Despite a tariff pause, Goldman Sachs estimates a significant chance of a recession within the next year, highlighting growing economic uncertainty.

title: Drunk passenger detained for molesting air hostess on Indigo flight
content: On an IndiGo flight from Delhi to Shirdi on May 2, 2025, a male passenger was arrested for allegedly molesting an air hostess. The inebriated man reportedly touched the crew member inappropriately near the aircraft's toilet. Upon landing, security apprehended the accused, who was then handed over to Rahata Police, where a molestation case was registered against him.

title: Carnage at Eden Gardens! Riyan Parag smashes 6 sixes in a row
content: Riyan Parag's explosive hitting display, including six consecutive sixes, electrified Eden Gardens during Rajasthan Royals' IPL 2025 match against Kolkata Knight Riders. Parag's onslaught came after Andre Russell propelled KKR to a formidable total. Despite Parag's heroics, Rajasthan Royals are out of the playoff race, but his performance showcased the league's thrilling talent.

title: Melinda Gates' advice to daughter after she cried over baby questions
content: Phoebe Gates, Bill Gates' daughter, revealed her mother Melinda's advice on handling investor bias regarding future motherhood while raising funds for her startup, Phia. Gates and her co-founder, Sophia Kianni, encountered questions about their plans to have children, highlighting a persistent bias in venture capital.

title: Priyanka says Cong to back any action Centre takes to avenge Pahalgam
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra affirmed Congress's complete support for any governmental action responding to the Pahalgam terrorist attack, which resulted in 26 civilian deaths. The Congress Working Committee has passed a resolution reflecting this united stance. She expressed hope that the Union government would act decisively to avenge the killings of innocent civilians and firmly address Pakistan's support of terrorism.

title: 'There will be many bangs': Netanyahu vows action after Huthi missile strike
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu pledged retaliation against Yemen's Huthi rebels following a missile strike near Ben Gurion Airport. The missile, launched in support of Palestinians in Gaza, injured six and briefly halted flights. While the Israeli army attempted interception, the exact cause of the damage remains unclear, with Netanyahu promising future action against the group.

title: BJP hits out at Congress' Ajay Rai over Rafale with 'nimbu-mirchi' jibe
content: Uttar Pradesh Congress president Ajay Rai mocked the BJP government with a 'toy Rafale' amid criticism over the Pahalgam terror attack. The BJP retaliated, accusing Congress of demoralizing the armed forces and echoing Pakistani narratives. This exchange occurs against the backdrop of India's recent Rs 63,000 crore deal for 26 Rafale Marine fighter aircraft to bolster naval capabilities.

title: Won’t fire ‘total stiff’ Fed chair Powell before term ends in 2026: Trump
content: President Trump stated he won't remove Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell before his term ends in 2026, despite calling him "a total stiff" and urging lower interest rates. Trump acknowledged Powell isn't a fan but anticipates eventual rate cuts. This declaration aims to reassure markets unsettled by Trump's trade policies, including tariffs on various countries, while trade negotiations continue.

title: Anantapur libraries to become hubs of learning, creativity
content: Joint Collector Shiv Narayan Sharma, convened a meeting with officials from all 79 libraries, the Grandhalaya Samsthas to train children in drawing, painting and other creative disciplines

title: Election Commission to develop new digital interface for voters, other stakeholders
content: The new one-stop platform, ECINET, will integrate and reorient over 40 of the EC’s existing mobile and web applications, including the Voter Helpline app, Voter Turnout app, etc

title: Jaishankar says India is looking for partners, not preachers; highlights New Delhi's 'Russia realism'
content: Europe had ‘entered a certain zone of a reality check’, and must display some sensitivity and mutuality of interest for deeper ties with India, the External Affairs Minister said

title: Council of CBSE Schools seeks rollback of tax hike for buses
content: The Council expresses concerns over the financial burden of the MVD’s mandate to install three CCTVs in each bus

title: Kerala not to implead in Waqf Amendment Act case in Supreme Court
content: The Kerala government was one of the first in the country to fiercely oppose the legislation. The Kerala Waqf Board has filed a petition for being impleaded in the case. The court will hear the case on Monday

title: My responsibility to give befitting reply to those who cast evil eye on India: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh
content: Rajnath Singh’s assertion came as India is mulling retaliatory measures against Pakistan in view of the cross-border linkages to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people

title: Israeli Strikes Kill 16, Including 3 Children, Says Gaza Agency
content: Gaza's civil defence agency on Sunday said Israeli strikes on the Palestinian territory killed 16 people, including at least three children.

title: "Prevailing War Threats": Cantonment In Punjab Preps For Blackout Drill Amid Tension With Pakistan
content: All lights will be switched off at the cantonment area in Punjab's Ferozepur tonight for half-an-hour from 9 pm to 9.30 pm in a blackout exercise amid heightened tension with Pakistan.

title: "Not Something I'm Looking To Do": Trump On Running For 3rd Term
content: US President Donald Trump said in an interview airing Sunday that he is not seriously considering running for a constitutionally-barred third White House term, after musing publicly over the idea.

title: "Not One And Done": Netanyahu's Multiple Strike Warning After Houthi Attack
content: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday pledged multiple strikes against Yemen's Houthi rebels after a missile fired by the Iran-backed group landed near Ben Gurion Airport-- the country's main international airport.

title: Class 10 Girl Ranked 1st In Bengal School Weeks After She Died Of Jaundice
content: A student from West Bengal's Bardhaman, who took the Class 10 state board exams while extremely ill, has come first at her school and possibly the district. But Thoibi Mukherjee is no longer around to celebrate.

title: "No Hate Against Muslims": A Owaisi Recounts Navy Officer's Wife's Appeal
content: Her husband, a Navy officer, was shot dead by terrorists in the deadly Pahalgam terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir, and she, mourning by his side, became the face of the tragedy. A Owaisi harnessed the woman's message to drive home a point.

title: On CCTV, Tourists Seen Running At Pahalgam Market After Terror Attack
content: CCTV footage from a market downhill from the picturesque meadow of Pahalgam in Jammu and Kashmir's Baisaran valley showed tourists including children running and vehicles speeding down the road, an hour after the terror attack began.

title: Cricket Match Gone Wrong: 18-Year-Old Beaten To Death With Bat In UP
content: A cricket match took a turn for the worse towards its fag end when two players clashed over the last ball in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr, resulting in the death on an 18-year-old.

title: A Mystery 36-Digit Credit Made UP Farmer 'Richest' Man, Bank Says...
content: Sitting in his humble home in a remote village of Uttar Pradesh's Hathras, Ajit was in disbelief when his account reflected a bank balance comprising 36 digits.

title: At Least One Dead, Several Critically Injured In Houston Shooting
content: At least one person was killed when up to 14 people were shot at a party in Houston early Sunday, police said.

title: Accident-Prone Area, Congested Lanes: Official On Stampede In Goa Temple
content: The sloping ground near the temple in Goa where a deadly stampede claimed six lives was accident-prone with a similar but minor incident reported in the past, an official said as the condition of the critically injured victims remained stable.

title: Watch: 25-Metre-Deep Crater At Israel's Biggest Airport After Houthi Missile Strike
content: A ballistic missile fired by Yemen's Houthi rebels towards Israel on Sunday landed just 75 meters from Terminal 3 of Ben Gurion Airport outside Tel Aviv-- the country's biggest international airport.

title: Damaged Walls, Ceilings: Jharkhand Hospital Where Roof Collapse Killed 3
content: The three patients who died at Jamshedpur's Mahatma Gandhi Memorial hospital fire yesterday, were abandoned by their families. These abandoned patients were kept in a dilapidated balcony of the hospital.

title: Air India Suspends Tel Aviv Flights Till May 6 After Houthi Missile Strike
content: Air India has suspended flights to Israel's capital Tel Aviv for the next two days following the Houthi rebels' missile attack at the Ben Gurion airport this morning. A flight from Delhi was diverted to Abu Dhabi after the incident, the airlines said

title: Passenger On Delhi-Shirdi IndiGo Flight Assaults Air Hostess, Arrested
content: An air hostess was allegedly molested by a drunk male passenger on a Delhi-Shirdi flight in Maharashtra, police said on Sunday.

title: "Radicalisation, Militancy Poses Challenge": Bengal Governor On Murshidabad Riot
content: West Bengal Governor C V Ananda Bose has submitted a report on the recent riots in Murshidabad district to the Union Ministry of Home Affairs, mentioning that the "twin spectre of radicalisation and militancy" poses a serious challenge to the state.

title: All About Santhara, Jain Ritual Of Voluntary Fasting To Death
content: A three-year-old girl suffering from a terminal illness died after beingadministered Santhara  a Jain ritual of voluntary fasting unto death  by a spiritual leader in Indore.

title: Pak MP From Imran Khan's Party Shares Exit Plan In Case Of War With India
content: A Pakistani MP from former prime minister Imran Khan's party has revealed his exit plan in the event of an attack by India.

title: 'Most of Pak army generals, ministers already booked ticket to leave country': BJP
content: Amid escalating tensions following the Pahalgam massacre, BJP spokesperson Pradeep Bhandari claimed that panic has gripped Pakistan's leadership. He alleged that Pakistani ministers and army generals are booking tickets to flee the country, fearing a decisive response from India under Prime Minister Modi's leadership.

title: 'Aaj haar gye to ... ': Goenka's hug for Rishabh Pant goes viral
content: Punjab Kings, fresh off a victory, are set to clash with Lucknow Super Giants in Dharamshala, a match crucial for IPL 2025 playoff aspirations. PBKS, currently fourth, relies on Shreyas Iyer's leadership and a strong bowling attack. The scenic HPCA Stadium in Dharamshala is set to join the IPL 2025 hosting roster as Punjab Kings take on Lucknow Super Giants in a crucial mid-table clash on Sunday evening — a fixture that could prove pivotal in shaping the playoff race.

title: 'Failed nation, poor country': Owaisi tears into Pakistan
content: Asaduddin Owaisi has strongly denounced Pakistan, labeling it a “failed nation” and accusing it of fostering terrorism. He condemned communal divisions following the Pahalgam attack, urging unity against those who seek to weaken India. Opposition parties have pressed the government to take decisive action, ensuring justice for victims' families and eradicating terrorism, with full support pledged for governmental measures.

title: 'Four sixes in an over': Riyan Parag's two-year-old prophecy comes true
content: Riyan Parag's old tweet about hitting four sixes in an over resurfaced after he smashed five sixes off Moeen Ali in an over at Eden Gardens. Parag reached his half-century and technically hit six sixes in six balls by dispatching Varun Chakaravarthy for a maximum in the following over.

title: Karnataka NEET student made to remove 'janeu' before exam; BJP protests
content: A controversy flared in Karnataka after a student was asked to remove his 'janeu' before a NEET exam. The BJP protested outside the exam center. The Karnataka High Court is hearing a PIL about similar incidents during CET exams. Deputy chief minister DK Shivakumar opposed the removal of religious symbols during exams.

title: 'India needs partners, not preachers': Jaishankar once again tears into EU
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar criticizes European nations for their inconsistent stances on global issues. He emphasizes India's need for partners rather than those who preach without practicing. Jaishankar highlights Europe's need for a reality check. He recalls past statements on managing relations with China. He also points out the EU's contrasting responses to the Russia-Ukraine war and India-Pakistan tensions.

title: After 11 sixes in one game, Vaibhav Suryavanshi flops twice in a row
content: Teenage sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old Rajasthan Royals batsman, is facing a batting slump after his record-breaking century. Following a duck against Mumbai Indians and 4 runs against Kolkata Knight Riders, the team management is urging patience. Despite the recent setbacks, bowling coach Shane Bond emphasizes nurturing the young talent, shielding him from pressure, and allowing him to play freely.

title: 'Still feeling like 27': Russell turns back the clock with six-sixes blitz
content: Andre Russell's explosive unbeaten 57 propelled Kolkata Knight Riders to a formidable 206/4 against Rajasthan Royals. Russell's innings, featuring six sixes, marked his entry into the 1000-run club at Eden Gardens. He attributed his success to smart decision-making against spinners, emphasizing his preference to attack them, crucial for KKR's playoff aspirations.

title: Warren Buffet has $169 billion net worth: A look at his investments
content: Warren Buffett, the legendary investor, will retire as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway at the end of 2025, passing the reins to Greg Abel. This announcement, made at the annual shareholders' meeting, marks a significant transition after Buffett's 54-year tenure.

title: 'Test cricketers used to get Rs 50 per day, Ranji Trophy players Rs 5'
content: In a conversation with Bombay Sport Exchange, veteran administrator Ratnakar Shetty recounted Indian cricket's evolution from its humble beginnings. He highlighted the crucial financial support from royal families and corporate figures in the early days when BCCI operated with limited resources.

title: RCB all-rounder’s IPL trophy pledge breaks the internet
content: Krunal Pandya expressed amazement at the massive fan support for Royal Challengers Bengaluru after their thrilling two-run victory over Chennai Super Kings. Witnessing the crowd's enthusiasm outside the stadium at 12:30 am, Pandya vowed to help RCB end their title drought this year. Ayush Mhatre's 94 and Ravindra Jadeja's 77 were not enough as RCB edged past CSK.

title: Who is Kunal Singh Rathore? Meet RR's IPL debutant from Kota
content: Kunal Singh Rathore, a 22-year-old wicketkeeper-batter from Kota, Rajasthan, made his IPL debut for Rajasthan Royals against Kolkata Knight Riders in IPL 2025. He was acquired for Rs 30 lakh, and is the first cricketer from Kota to secure an IPL contract. Rathore has played domestic cricket, scoring 254 runs in 12 T20 matches.

title: 'He wasn't thinking about his 100': Sehwag lauds selfless Ayush Mhatre
content: In a thrilling IPL match, 17-year-old Ayush Mhatre's impressive 94 nearly secured a CSK victory against RCB. Despite missing a century, his selfless play drew praise, including from Virender Sehwag, who noted Mhatre prioritized the team's needs. Mhatre and Jadeja's 114-run partnership brought CSK close to chasing 214, showcasing Mhatre's maturity and talent on the big stage.

title: Sikh student confronts Rahul Gandhi on 1984 riots, Operation Blue Star; he responds
content: During a US visit, Rahul Gandhi encountered tough questions from a Sikh student. The query concerned the Congress party's history with the Sikh community. It specifically addressed the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. The student questioned Gandhi's stance on Sikh rights. Gandhi acknowledged past mistakes. He expressed a strong connection with the Sikh community. BJP criticized Gandhi, sharing the video.

title: Eliminated but not done! Why Riyan Parag made 3 bold changes vs KKR
content: Ajinkya Rahane, Kolkata Knight Riders' captain, chose to bat first after winning the toss against Rajasthan Royals at Eden Gardens. KKR brought in Moeen Ali and Ramandeep Singh, aiming to set a strong total. Rajasthan Royals, led by Riyan Parag, made three changes, including Hasaranga's return. Rajasthan Royals, already out of playoff contention, made three changes to their line-up.

title: RCB wicketkeeper-batter gives Romario Shepherd's a wild nickname
content: An old video of Jitesh Sharma comparing Romario Shepherd's strength to a rhino resurfaced after Shepherd's explosive 14-ball 53 against CSK. Shepherd credited his attacking nature and strength, embracing the 'rhino' nickname. He thanked Rajat Patidar and Tim David for their confidence-boosting support, while also acknowledging Dinesh Karthik's mentorship in improving his batting approach.

title: Who is Mitch Owen? PBKS rope in BBL star after Maxwell ruled out of IPL
content: Punjab Kings have signed Australian all-rounder Mitchell Owen as a replacement for Glenn Maxwell, who has been ruled out of the remainder of the 2025 IPL season due to a fractured finger. Owen, a 23-year-old Tasmanian, joins PBKS for Rs 3 crore, bringing his aggressive batting style and seam-bowling abilities to the team.

title: Home Minister rules out NIA probe into Hindutva activist’s murder
content: CM defends plans to set up special security force to curb communal violence in the coastal districts.

title: 339 developmental works in Nellore Rural constituency near completion
content: MLA Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy fixes launch date as May 15;  678 leaders and activists to inaugurate projects

title: BRS demands release of ₹800 crore fee dues of degree colleges
content: Harish Rao says four universities didn’t conduct degree exams so far due to non-release of fee dues to private colleges

title: Under shadow of India-Pak tensions, Rajnath to host Japanese Defence Minister Nakatani for talks on May 5
content: It is learnt that the two sides will also review the situation in the strategic waters of the East and South China Seas, where Beijing has been increasing its military posturing

title: Kerala’s pioneering literacy advocate K.V. Rabiya passes away
content: Known as the “ambassador of literacy movement”, Ms. Rabiya defied adversity her entire life. She illuminated countless lives with the power of knowledge.

title: Students prefer industry-relevant curriculum over brand
content: Mahindra University’s Tirupati event sees aspirants favouring industry-aligned curriculum and faculty with strong credentials

title: Amaravati will be Andhra Pradesh’s backbone, says AP Chambers
content: It will have the desired multiplier effect for the State’s growth, observes Chambers president Bhaskar Rao

title: YouTuber Claims Top Cop, IAS Officers' Link In Betting App Scam, Faces Case
content: Police have registered a case against YouTuber Anvesh after he alleged that the Telangana DGP and other senior officials were involved in a Rs 300 crore betting app scam.

title: Parents Celebrate Son Who Failed His Class 10 Exam In Karnataka
content: It was a disappointing result. But it did not mean the end of the world. At least for the parents who chose to see the glimmer of light and kept their faith in the good old "don't give up" credo.

title: What Tim Cook, Jamie Dimon said on Warren Buffett's retirement move
content: Industry titans like Tim Cook and Jamie Dimon lauded Warren Buffett's remarkable legacy following his announcement to retire as Berkshire Hathaway's CEO at the end of the year. Greg Abel, currently vice chairman, is poised to succeed Buffett, a move analysts anticipated. However, Abel's appointment has drawn criticism from environmental groups, citing Berkshire Hathaway Energy's coal plant operations.

title: Artillery crisis? Pakistan’s ammo could last only 4 days in war: Report
content: Pakistan's artillery ammunition reserves are critically low, potentially limiting its capacity to sustain a war with India to just four days, according to sources. Outdated production facilities and recent arms deals with Ukraine have exacerbated the shortage. This deficit significantly impacts Pakistan's military preparedness, raising concerns among military leadership about their ability to resist potential offensives.

title: Watch: Pissed off MS Dhoni yells at Khaleel Ahmed during RCB vs CSK
content: Despite valiant efforts from Ayush Mhatre (94) and Ravindra Jadeja (77*), Chennai Super Kings fell short by two runs against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in a high-scoring chase. The loss, CSK's ninth, keeps them at the bottom. During the match, MS Dhoni expressed frustration with Khaleel Ahmed, who had a forgettable day with the ball.

title: When Neena Gupta recalled Satish Kaushik’s marriage offer after pregnancy
content: Satish Kaushik, who passed away in 2023, was a close friend of Neena Gupta since college. In a viral video, Neena recalls how Kaushik offered to marry her during her controversial 1989 pregnancy to support her. His daughter Masaba also paid heartfelt tribute after his demise.

title: TMC hits out at BJP for 'raising questions on the Pratishtha of Digha temple'
content: Following objections from the BJP regarding the naming of a newly inaugurated shrine in Digha, West Bengal, as Jagannath Dham, Trinamool Congress has accused the BJP-led Odisha government of hypocrisy. The Odisha government has ordered an investigation into the temple's name and the alleged use of surplus wood from the Puri shrine for idols.

title: Virat Kohli creates history, becomes first ever to achieve this big IPL feat
content: Virat Kohli etched his name in IPL history, becoming the first player to score 500+ runs in eight seasons. His recent 62 off 33 balls against CSK propelled him to the Orange Cap. Kohli now leads IPL 2025 with 505 runs, averaging 63.13. RCB edged out CSK in a thrilling match, marking their first league double over their rivals.

title: 'Head open, brain spilled out': Mystery shrouds advocate’s death in Bengaluru
content: A 46-year-old advocate, H Jagadish, was found dead on NICE Road near Kengeri under mysterious circumstances. His cousin suspects foul play, citing injuries and a missing mobile phone. Police are investigating all angles, including a possible staged accident, while awaiting the autopsy report to determine the cause of death.

title: On MS Dhoni's captaincy: 'Whether the brain is still ticking for him...'
content: MS Dhoni's captaincy and batting form are under scrutiny as Chennai Super Kings suffered a narrow defeat against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in IPL 2025. Adam Gilchrist questioned Dhoni's tactical decisions, particularly the choice of bowler in the crucial 19th over. He also pondered whether Dhoni's sharpness is waning as he nears retirement.

title: Who is Greg Abel? Top 10 things to know about Warren Buffett’s successor
content: Warren Buffett is stepping down as Berkshire Hathaway's CEO by the end of 2025, with Greg Abel, a Canadian executive, appointed as his successor. Abel, currently overseeing Berkshire's non-insurance operations, will manage the company's diverse enterprises and substantial stock investments. He faces the challenge of maintaining Berkshire's decentralised structure and replicating Buffett's market performance.

title: Congress will back any action by Centre on Pahalgam terror attack: Priyanka Gandhi
content: Congress leader pledged that the party will support for government action after Pahalgam terror attack, urging swift response and accountability

title: NEET-UG held at over 5,400 centres under strict security, no reports of untoward incidents
content: The strict measures came a year after alleged irregularities, including paper leaks, were flagged in NEET-UG that put the exam’s integrity under scanner

title: Heavy rain lashes several parts of Chittoor district
content: The downpour, which started around 2 p.m., lasted for a couple of hours, leaving several residential areas under the Chittoor Municipal Corporation limits waterlogged

title: Andhra Pradesh Forensic Science Laboratory functioning with 96% success rate, says DGP
content: Investigation officers should focus on quality while collecting evidences in all cases: Harish Kumar Gupta

title: YSR Congress Party leader Anil Kumar Yadav denies involvement in illegal mining activities in Nellore district
content: The former Minister accuses the Nellore MP of getting the mining industry into his clutches and threatening his rivals of dire consequences

title: N. Ram is a towering sentinel of Indian journalism: Stalin
content: The CM, MNM president Kamal Haasan, and PMK president Anbumani Ramadoss extend birthday greetings to the veteran journalist

title: ADAK caged fish farming project strikes gold in Neyyar Dam, benefiting the local forest tribal community
content: Several local restaurants serving freshwater fish delicacies, including Mahseer, Rohu, Cutla, Anabas and endemic catfish varieties, are proving a magnet for weekend holidaymakers from Thiruvananthapuram and neighbouring Tamil Nadu

title: Sudden rains lash in Andhra Pradesh, alert issued
content: Officials have been told to issue timely warnings to residents in low-lying areas of possible inundation. The APSDMA has been asked to keep personnel ready for rescue operations if required

title: ₹30 crore master plan for the development of Kottarakkara Mahaganapathi Temple
content: Besides the ₹5 crore allocated in the budget for constructing a pilgrim house and amenity centre, a development plan will incorporate the Travancore Devaswom Board’s ₹25 crore worth works

title: Govt. filing false cases against leaders, alleges YSRCP
content: Police failed to provide security to party president Jagan Mohan Reddy during his recent visit to Ramagiri, it alleges

title: Brahmin community protests in Kalaburagi over removal of students’ sacred thread at NEET exam centre
content: The protesters raised slogans and attempted to enter the exam centre premises, prompting police intervention

title: Experience beach and paddy lands at ‘Ente Keralam’ expo in Idukki
content: Kerala Tourism pavilion at the expo has put up artificial models of Kerala’s landscapes evoking the beauty of village tourism

title: About 61% of Sikkim’s butterfly species are in the Dzongu region, study finds
content: The 10-year documentation is a gift to the world in celebration of Sikkim’s 50 years of Statehood, lead author Sonam Wangchuk Lepcha said

title: Metro commuter penalised for spitting pan masala at Doddakalasandra station
content: The incident comes close on the heels of a video going viral showing a man consuming gutka inside a Namma Metro train

title: KPCC president K. Sudhakaran expresses strong will to continue in office despite rumours about his removal
content: He says “some quarters in the party” had cited his treatment at the Mayo Clinic in the US as disqualifying and sought his ouster. When asked whether the AICC general secretary in Kerala, Deepa Dasmunshi, had sought his removal, he demurred.

title: Young minds honour the past in Swathanthryakeerthi
content: 139-page book brought out by students of the Social Science Club at Government Upper Primary School, Vellamkulangara, in Alappuzha, chronicles the lives of 40 freedom fighters from district

title: Phone calls during last year’s Pooram chaos were ignored by ADGP, alleges Minister
content: Revenue Minister K. Rajan gives statement about ADGP M.R. Ajith Kumar to the team investigating the lapses in the conduct of last year’s Pooram

title: Steps will be taken to strengthen Vizianagaram DCCB and provide loans to farmers, says chairman
content: Priority will be given to modernisation of branches and reach out to more number of customers in the near future: Kimidi Nagarjuna

title: BEE urges public to set ACs at 24°C to save energy, cut bills, and support sustainability
content: BEE launches energy conservation campaign in Hyderabad to promote responsible AC usage for cost savings and environmental benefits

title: Nuggets get desired 'result' from surprise firings
content: A Nuggets executive pointed to the firings of Michael Malone and Calvin Booth as the reason behind the team's late-season surge that has them into the second round.

title: Rantanen's 'fitting' hat trick caps Stars' G7 win
content: Mikko Rantanen scored three goals in the third period, and the Dallas Stars utilized a furious rally to advance to the second round of the Stanley Cup playoffs, defeating the Colorado Avalanche 4-2 in Game 7 on Saturday night at American Airlines Center.

title: Sovereignty outduels Journalism to capture Derby
content: Sovereignty outdueled Journalism down the stretch on a muddy track to capture the 151st Kentucky Derby on Saturday at Churchill Downs.

title: Twins' Clemens homers at Fenway in front of dad
content: Kody Clemens, the son of former Red Sox pitcher Roger Clemens, homered into the right-field seats in the sixth inning during his first game at Fenway Park.

title: Canelo cruises, locks up Sept. clash with Crawford
content: After an uneventful decision victory over William Scull, Canelo Alvarez made things official with Terence Crawford as the two faced off in the ring to announce their Sept. 12 superfight.

title: Scheffler's 54-hole lead largest on tour since '11
content: Scottie Scheffler's lead at the CJ Cup Byron Nelson is 8 shots as he stands at 23 under entering the final round Sunday.

title: Fan who fell at PNC Park awake, shows 'progress'
content: Kavan Markwood, the 20-year-old who slipped off a railing during the seventh inning of the Pittsburgh Pirates' 4-3 win over the Chicago Cubs on Wednesday night, is awake and alert, according to Jennifer Phillips, who has organized a fundraiser for him.

title: 🏀 What this coaching change means for the Spurs
content: What's next for San Antonio after Pop's move to the front office? What does Mitch Johnson bring? Our NBA insiders break down the news.

title: Neither parenthood nor McLaren can slow Verstappen in Miami
content: There's a myth in racing that becoming a parent makes a racer slow down. Max Verstappen is proving that wrong.

title: NBA playoffs 2025: Everything to know ahead of Sunday's massive Game 7
content: The Western Conference produced two Game 7s this weekend. The Nuggets claimed the first one but how can each team advance on Sunday?

title: Jets-Blues Game 7 preview: Key players to watch, final score predictions
content: It all comes down to this for the final ticket to the second round. Here's what to watch for both teams.

title: 12 reasons why Naoya Inoue defines must-see boxing
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. breaks down Inoue's game in 12 categories, from offense to defense and power and speed.

title: Terence Crawford is the opponent Canelo Álvarez -- and boxing fans -- need
content: After another less-than-exciting performance, Canelo Alvarez's next fight is finally what boxing fans deserve.

title: Which Braves are the REAL Braves?
content: No team has made the playoffs after starting 0-7, but Atlanta has played better since. Will that continue -- and will it be enough?

title: Arsenal ratings: Gunners poor beyond Rice, Ødegaard in loss to Bournemouth
content: Arsenal made it three league games without a win as a poor second half swung things in Bournemouth's favor. The one plus: no injuries ahead of a pivotal Champions League semifinal, second leg, at PSG this Wednesday.

title: The worst game in Premier League history? Southampton might just be the worst team
content: The game was so bad, some fans called it "El Crapico," a game between the two worst teams in the league.

title: Messi scores in Miami rout to snap losing streak
content: Lionel Messi struck the emphatic final goal as Inter Miami snapped a three-game losing streak with a 4-1 home win over the New York Red Bulls.

title: Kane comes within 1 min of trophy as Bayern draw
content: RB Leipzig's Yussuf Poulsen scored a stoppage-time goal to snatch a 3-3 draw against Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich on Saturday and delay the Bavarians' title celebrations by at least a day.

title: Barcelona survive scare to stay clear of Madrid
content: Barcelona extended the gap atop LaLiga to seven points with a 2-1 comeback win at relegated Real Valladolid on Saturday thanks to second-half strikes by Raphinha and Fermin Lopez.

title: Arteta: 'Rage' from loss must fuel Arsenal vs. PSG
content: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta called on his players to harness their rage from Saturday's 2-1 home defeat by Bournemouth in Wednesday's Champions League semifinal second leg at PSG.

title: U.S. duo Balogun, Dike net 1st goals since injuries
content: United States and Monaco striker Folarin Balogun scored his first Ligue 1 goal this year following shoulder surgery.

title: Napoli win to move step closer to Serie A title
content: League leaders Napoli moved one step closer to winning the Serie A title with a 1-0 win at relegation-threatened Lecce on Saturday, taking the visitors provisionally six points clear of Scudetto rivals Inter Milan.

title: Jamie Vardy blows whistle after ref suffers injury
content: Leicester's clash with Southampton was held up for 11 minutes after referee David Webb was forced out of the game after being injured in a collision.

title: Firmino captains Al Ahli to 1st Asian CL title
content: Saudi Arabia's Al Ahli beat Japan's Kawasaki Frontale 2-0 to win the Asian Champions League Elite title for the first time at a raucous King Abdullah Sports City Stadium.

title: Luck Index 2025: Who needs luck on their side next season?
content: Turnover luck, coordinator upgrade, transfer portal haul? They all could lead to some upswings for a select few teams.

title: 'We've got the identity that fits us': Wisconsin turns back the clock to move forward
content: Wisconsin coach Luke Fickell is going back to the Badgers' roots in a crucial Year 3 for his program.

title: Fatherhood, a decade in F1 give Verstappen perspective on what's important
content: Max Verstappen's role as a dad isn't the only reason for his increasingly elder-statesman status in F1.

title: How Wrexham paid their way to promotion, and why the Premier League requires more than that
content: Wrexham's promotion might look miraculous, but it's actually a combination of factors that other Premier League hopefuls shouldn't try to replicate.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Juventus make first concrete move to sign Højlund
content: Juventus have taken the first concrete steps to sign Rasmus Højlund from Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Draft tiers at guard
content: Eric Moody goes through the different tiers at the guard position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.
